975.commentText: Before anything else happens, the appropriate level gets loaded. Next, the player and rival vehicles are spawned, and the \nvehicle id variables get set. Position and rotation doesn't matter at this point, as they will be processed in another state.

976.commentText: A prefab containing a few obstacles is spawned, the UI and menu layouts are set to "scenario", and certain input actions get \nblocked, to ensure that the player can't cheat or interfere with the scenario.

3.description:
This graph contains all of the states that run in a sequence during this scenario.
Double-click on them or use the tabs if you want to inspect or edit them.
3.name: States

974.commentText: Here are all of the states that logically process every step of the scenario.

977.commentText: The File Path node outputs race path data from an input file string. This race path data includes start positions, so here the \nvehicles get teleported to their assigned start positions. The player vehicle gets freeze mode enabled, and the AI vehicles stop.

978.commentText: The screen fades from black, the Start Screen UI displays some basic text about the scenario, and a countdown is run before \ngameplay begins.

981.commentText: If the player successfully crosses the finish line, then the End Screen UI is shown, with results and some text. On this screen, \nthere are a few buttons that the player can select to either restart the scenario or continue. Finish text is determined by the \nplayer's race placement.

63.commentText:
Each state manages a simple aspect of gameplay. 
There are multiple exit conditions.

Main runs the race logic, including the vehicle AI, timer, 
and checkpoints. The state exits when the player 
reaches the finish line.

Damage tracks the player vehicle damage and triggers 
a failure if the damage exceeds the limit.

Player Reset checks if the player pressed the "Reset" 
button, and then resets the scenario.

982.commentText: If the player fails to finish the race, then the End Screen UI is shown, displaying "Failure".\nNote that the "failed" pin is preset as true here.

979.commentText: The File Path node loads race path data containing checkpoints along the route, and the File Race node takes that input and \nstarts a race with the given vehicles. Unless "Auto Start AI" is enabled, AI vehicles should use the AI Follow Waypoints node \nwith the AI Path input, so that they can race.

980.commentText: Updates UI elements, including the timer, checkpoints, and world markers. Also, the Race Data node provides some valuable \ninfo about the given vehicle during the race. Race placement (1st, 2nd, etc.) gets passed through as a transition variable.
